title: Szechwan Shrimp Recipe
description: Szechuan shrimp is easy to make by warming cooked shrimp in a thick and spicy sauce with green onion. Simply delicious served over hot rice.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Asian Chinese Szechwan Shrimp 4.4 (3,302) 2,373 Reviews 332 Photos Szechuan shrimp is an impressive dish made with simple ingredients. I usually make it for company. For more or less heat, adjust the amount of red pepper. Serve over hot steamed rice. Submitted by FOODGU1 Updated on February 23, 2023 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 332 332 332 332 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 5 mins Total Time: 15 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 4 tablespoons water 2 tablespoons ketchup 1 tablespoon soy sauce 2 teaspoons cornstarch 1 teaspoon honey ½ teaspoon crushed red pepper ¼ teaspoon ground ginger 1 tablespoon vegetable oil ¼ cup sliced green onions 4 cloves garlic, minced 12 ounces cooked shrimp, tails removed Directions Stir together water, ketchup, soy sauce, cornstarch, honey, crushed red pepper, and ground ginger in a small bowl until combined. Set aside. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir green onions and garlic in hot oil until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Stir in cooked shrimp; toss to coat with oil. Pour in ketchup mixture. Cook and stir until sauce is bubbly and thickened. Joy Flowers Best I Made It Print 4,059 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Szechwan Shrimp 01 of 332 Photo by  Joy Flowers Best 02 of 332 Photo by  Donna Gluecklich-Sullivan 06/11/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow I doubled the sauce because looking at it didn't seem like enough, glad I did. I didn't change anything except doubling the sauce. So delicious!! I'll be making this again and add chicken and or a vegetable to it too. I couldn't get enough of it!! THANK YOU! So delicious! 03 of 332 Photo by  SpryBun8781 10/29/2023 Excellent flavor with a nice subtle heat. I didn’t have shrimp so I chopped up boneless chicken breast. Stir fried that first in oil, then added the garlic & green onions. Cooked that for a minute. Then added the liquid, stirred until thickened and served it over white rice. 04 of 332 Photo by  SmartPecan2891 10/11/2023 05 of 332 Photo by  Rachel Allen 08/11/2021 06 of 332 Photo by  Donna 07/17/2021 I made it with chicken instead of shrimp!? 07 of 332 Photo by  Meg 07/03/2021 08 of 332 Photo by  Jonathan Blackmore 05/08/2021 09 of 332 Photo by  Kimberly Bastien 01/16/2021 10 of 332 Photo by  Renee Spence 12/20/2020 Yummy with slight heat! Super easy I added sesame seeds as another reviewer suggested and some sesame oil in the water I made the rice in. name: FOODGU1
instructions: Stir together water, ketchup, soy sauce, cornstarch, honey, crushed red pepper, and ground ginger in a small bowl until combined. Set aside.;Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir green onions and garlic in hot oil until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Stir in cooked shrimp; toss to coat with oil. Pour in ketchup mixture. Cook and stir until sauce is bubbly and thickened. Joy Flowers Best
